pr_title: feat: add support for application overloads (DHIS2-9092)

timeline.author: larshelge

replies.bodyText: Nice, yeah agreed - I didn’t like having to convert it to a list before doing anything anyway!
replies.author: amcgee

timeline.bodyText: Move up to class scope as static final.
timeline.author: larshelge

timeline.bodyText: Maybe use "appOverrideFilter" as name per convention instead of qualified class name.
timeline.author: larshelge
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -111,6 +111,12 @@
     </init-param>
   </filter>
 
+  <filter>
+    <filter-name>org.hisp.dhis.servlet.filter.AppOverrideFilter</filter-name>

replies.bodyText: @larshelge I wasn't sure about this - to use the delegated proxy filter the filter name needs to exactly match the id of the bean, which has the convention of being the full qualified class name.  Which convention should we prefer?
replies.author: amcgee

replies.bodyText: @larshelge should we mention the reason for this exception to the convention in a comment so future devs don't get confused and try to change it?  Can we add comments to web.xml?
replies.author: amcgee

replies.bodyText: I took a look at some other places using DelegatingFilterProxy and followed their example - can use appOverrideFilter here if using @Component decorator instead of adding the Bean to beans.xml, so made that change here.  No comment needed.
replies.author: amcgee

timeline.bodyText: Ideally this wouldn't duplicate the app cloning list in dhis-web-apps, but I don't think it would be trivial to refactor them at the moment.  Eventually this should go away when we move to the /apps/xyz app base
timeline.author: amcgee
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -36,13 +36,49 @@

timeline.bodyText: Apply DHIS 2 code style.
timeline.author: larshelge

replies.bodyText: Where is the code style documented?  Is there a lint tool?  @stian-sandvold made the code-style recommendation (spaces around the 0) on this line
replies.author: amcgee

replies.bodyText: Here specifically, brackets go on new lines.
replies.author: larshelge

timeline.bodyText: Perhaps some defensive null checks here to see if activities is actually defined to avoid NullPointerException, with some logging maybe.
timeline.author: larshelge

replies.bodyText: Also added to the existing code in AppController.java which was missing those checks (and copied here)
replies.author: amcgee

timeline.message: fix: correctly parse apps api filters

timeline.bodyText: Brackets on new lines.
timeline.author: larshelge

timeline.message: fix: redirect to launch url from index.action legacy requests
fix: inject full context path rather than relative URL to manifest.webapp
chore: revert to original app authority translation

timeline.bodyText: Remove commented out code.
